bio: I am currently a PT Realtor with property management experience and independent field representative work for mortgage companies with property preservation work.  I owned a medical transcription business for 10 years with experience in all medical specialties. I have extensive experience in virtual assisting, personal assistance, merchandising and general office work. My schedule is extremely flexible. My turnaround time for transcription is 24-hours with rush service availability. I work very well independently.

My terms for transcription are based on a per character line basis, which is negotiable. This can also be adjusted to per page or per job rate as well. I prefer to be designated as an independent contractor at $10/hour, but this rate is also negotiable depending on the complexity of the job.

bio:
Scillia Paralegal Solutions,Freelance Paralegal
October 2003 to Present
• Assists attorneys in document preparation, review and analysis; case management and client contact in various areas of law.

Koch Industries, Inc., Legal Assistant 
April 1998 to September 2003
• Assisted attorneys in secured transactions, including UCC filings; financial and commercial real estate transactions; software licensing agreements; aircraft purchase and special projects.
• Drafted and coordinated regulatory filings related to mergers and acquisitions, including Hart-Scott-Rodino pre-merger filings and SEC filings, and analyzed data for international pre-merger analysis.
• Negotiated and managed ISDA Master Agreements on behalf of parent company subsidiaries.
• Developed and maintained systems and processes, including databases, spreadsheets and reports, for regulatory filings, monitoring compliance with contracts, applicable laws and company policy, and for managing complex tasks.
• Managed information and research requests from attorneys on transactional, compliance and legal matters.
• Drafted agreements, board resolutions and other ancillary documents required in various transactions.

Wallace, Saunders, Austin, Brown & Enochs, Legal Assistant 
Oct 1996 to April 1998
• Case management and analysis related to insurance defense: personal injury and products liability.
• Analyzed and summarized medical, employment, various client and business records, and depositions. 
• Drafted pleadings, case status memorandum and correspondence.
• Established Legal Assistant Internship Program in association with Wichita State University. 

Summit Bancorp,Paralegal 
May 1995 to July 1996
• Drafted pleadings related to foreclosure; internal memoranda; case status; correspondence; and real estate conveyance and transactional documents. 
• Coordinated with commercial lending officers and outside outside counsel regarding case management.
• Reviewed title searches and updates.
